newsitem.title: USA: Fountain Oil Lelyaki test tops expectation.
newsitem.headline: Fountain Oil Lelyaki test tops expectation.

text.p: Fountain Oil Inc said Monday preliminary results from the logging of the first workover well in the Lelyaki field, Pruluki Region, Ukraine, are better than anticipated and the company looks very favorably on the further development of the field.

The well was recompleted by Kashtan Petroleum Ltd, owned by Fountain Oil and Ukrnafta, the Ukrainian national oil company, which is developing the Lelyaki field. Fountain Oil said it has a 40.5 percent interest in Kashtan Petroleum.

Based on preliminary on-site interpretation of the first workover well, the well's electrical logging results indicate that it has up to 17 meter (56 foot) pay zone, with an average porosity of 25 percent and an average oil saturation of 70 percent.
"We are encouraged by the upside potential these results indicate," chief executive Nils N. Trulsvik stated.

He also indicated Fountain Oil expects to be able to report an update of proven reserves for the Lelyaki field after recompletion, logging and flow testing of three or four wells has been accomplished.
Presently, the company said, it is preparing for the testing of the first workover well. The planned workover program involves a total of 12 wells in 1997.
